importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article's publication, indicating when the public learned about the crash investigation findings.
The date of the plane crash, which is central to the incident being reported.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The crash occurred on September 18, 2025, marking the critical event in the timeline of the incident.

keyTakeAways: Brett James, a Grammy-winning songwriter, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, along with two others on board.
The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the plane entered a 'tightening spiral' during flight, leading to the crash.
James had requested a visual approach to runway 7, which air traffic control approved, but failed to change to the common traffic advisory frequency, resulting in lost communication.
The plane, a Cirrus SR22T, flew over the runway and descended into a left turn before spiraling and crashing.
No mechanical issues were found in the wreckage, suggesting the crash was likely due to pilot error or communication failure.
Brett James was a highly regarded songwriter who collaborated with major artists such as Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A Grammy-winning songwriter, Brett James, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, in Franklin, North Carolina, along with two others. According to a preliminary report by the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB), the plane, a Cirrus SR22T, entered a 'tightening spiral' after James failed to switch to the common traffic advisory frequency, resulting in lost communication with air traffic control. Despite being cleared for a visual approach to runway 7, James did not adjust his radio frequency and announced a 360-degree turn, which led to the aircraft flying over the runway and descending into a left turn before crashing. No mechanical issues were found in the wreckage, suggesting the incident stemmed from a communication or procedural error. Brett James was a prominent figure in the music industry, known for collaborations with Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney, including the hit 'Jesus, Take the Wheel' and 'Out Last Night'.
title: Songwriter Brett James’ plane entered a 'tightening spiral' before crashing, the NTSB said in a preliminary report
